title: A Stunned World Reckons With Economic Fallout From Trump’s Tariffs
abstract: Not even America’s closest trading partners were spared by a policy broadside that spooked investors and left policymakers scrambling to formulate responses.
byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi and River Akira Davis

title: Europe Has Economic Power. Can It Use It Against Trump’s Tariffs?
abstract: European leaders have said they would prefer to negotiate. If that fails, their response could go beyond anything they’ve tried before.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Are Latest Sign of His Second-Term Appetite for Risk
abstract: President Trump’s announcement went beyond most predictions, showing a greater willingness to follow his instincts even when critics — and some allies — consider failure a likely outcome.

multimedia.caption: President Trump unveiled expansive tariffs in a ceremony at the White House on Wednesday, going far beyond what many economists and analysts had expected.

title: The War on Nature in Ukraine
abstract: Fires and smoke foul the air. Toxins seep into the earth and water. Habitats for wildlife disappear. Experts call it ecocide.
byline: By Brendan Hoffman and Evelina Riabenko

title: What Is ‘Qatargate,’ the Latest Furor Embroiling Israel?
